lines.text: They seem harmless enough when they're just by themselves. But that's the problem, isn't it?
Huh?

Ants are never alone. You know if you see one, there are hundreds more just waiting for you around the corner, marching one by one by one. I mean, I'm not an expert on ants or any thing, I just can't be sure.
What?
Your boyfriend left you with the bill.
He's not my boyfriend.
Okay, your father then.
You think I'd stiff you after such great service, Lola? There ya go. Why don't you go buy yourself a personality.

[waking up]
What happened to my clothes?
They're over here.
What are they doing over there?
Well, you puked on them, so I washed them.
You took my clothes off?
Well, I was gonna wash them with you in them, but then I figured what the hell, I'll try it the hard way.
I'm in kind of a hurry.
Everybody's in a hurry. I always said, if you wanna see people in a hurry, work in the Post Office.
[last lines]

Have you ever actually seen me jog when I'm not being chased by a bad man? A really, really bad man? Have you ever seen that? You know, when I was a kid my father used to bring me down here, and we'd shoot the seagulls and fry them up and eat them later. And that was when this was just a little park with a fawn, and they got bigger. But that was when the Eskimos owned it. But then it got too cold, so then they moved down south, the Floridian Eskimos.
Do you ever stop talking?
No, I don't. I'll just talk and talk.
Are you buying?
I'm buying. And I'm talking...
